website_summaries.verdict: This mid tower offers a futuristic look and a large number of cooling options.
pros: Two 120-millimeter and one 140-millimeter LED fan pre-installed
case has a total cooling capacity of up to eight fans
Has space for a top 240-millimeter dual radiator
Good ventilation, and optimized for water cooling
cons: Front panel can be difficult to open and close
Some reports of this case arriving damaged

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mid Tower
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful case with the perfect amount of room for my Z170AR paired with an i56600k with the corsair H110i (does NOT fit without cutting part of the upper case, and still trying to get it to fit completely) and my GTX 1070 and my 1000w power supply. With the detachable hard drive bay area, i was able to mount a cheap ol' rosewill 120mm fan in the level that it was and have perfect air flow. All in all, this case is perfect, unless you have the H110i like me, but the H100i fits perfect, which is taken from the NZXT webpage.
customer_reviews.author: Niklaus

customer_reviews.title: Nice but faulty, poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Got this case for a new build. Put everything together and the fans don't work. It's past the return period by the time I got all the parts and put it together (building my 12 year old daughter a pc with her) so can't go that route. Registered on the NZXT website and "opened a ticket" and have not heard back for a few days. Contacted them again still no answer. The case is nice, the power switch and USB headers work. I unplugged the fans and put them right into the Mobo and they work. The switch on top to controls the fans is just a useless decoration. Not happy with the lack of response from mfg.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it is great case. The fans are super quiet
customer_reviews.text: Power buttons are little and flimsy. They are hard for a someone with big fingers to push. The latch to keep the front cover closed quit working the first day. The plastic rings around the cutouts inside need to be glued in before you touch anything else if you want to NOT go insane trying to keep them in while you route your cables. Otherwise it is great case. The fans are super quiet. There is lots of airflow. It looks very nice and there is plenty of room inside. I kept the case even with the front latch not working.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Nice case.  Trust the brand
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good case, though it's probably a dinosaur by today's standards. Lots of drive slots, 5.25, 3.5 and other trays. Acrylic window, smooth edges through 'n through, plenty of space for fans. I kinda had a hard time finding a good place to put a small water-cooler. I dinged it a star because my power button finicky and the door that covers the bays. I didn't have these problems with the 1st one I bought about a year and a half ago, but this most recent one didn't work as smoothly. Gunmetal is a beautiful deep gray color.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Great computer case.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quiet computer case these cases are really getting hard to find new i'm glad I got one when I could because once their gone that's it all the newer case are made with no optical drives bays which I find to a wastes some programs still require a optical drive .
customer_reviews.author: phillip harris

customer_reviews.title: Great Aesthetics and Functionality, One Fatal Flaw
customer_reviews.text: The NZXT Phantom 410 is an extraordinary computer case. Its aesthetics and design really stand out in a room and it is second to none. The inside of the case is very spacious and provides ample building space. The hard drive cases provide support for both 3.5" and 2.5" drives. However, there is one fatal flaw for this case that involves cable routing. When routing cables through the back of the case behind the motherboard, the dampeners that line the holes VERY easily fall off, which can make for a very frustrating experience.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Wu

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room!
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint I really have right now is the front door that opens/closes to hid the optical drive is a little flimsy. I have only started using the case in the past two weeks. It is not very easy to open/close. Feels like it may break. Have not see any other issues reporting this matter so it may just be my case. Otherwise, I would definitely buy another one for my next build.
customer_reviews.author: Untitled

customer_reviews.title: I really like this case
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say, I really like this case. I would love it, if the instructions were better on cabling, like.. what the heck are these extra cables for.. LOL. and if my ASUS mobo fit in better with more clearance at top of case. I can't totally blame that on NZXT however, it's a combination of the two. (fans won't fit for water cooler inside case with ASUS Z170A). Overall, this is a slick tower case. Ah, one other minor thing, the rubber grommet openings pop out "easily" when you push cables thru it. Heck, glue those babies in guys.. I had this happen a few times.. :-)
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: and was easy to get around it
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I had with this case was fitting a dual fan radiator. The mounting holes lined up with only one fan. So essentially only one fan was screwed into both the case and the radiator The other was just screwed into the case. Not a big deal. However when I tried to put the top cover back on, it would not fit. I had to grind a clip that held the top screen in place. After that it fit ok. Not a big problem, and was easy to get around it. Everything else about this case is awesome, and is totally worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Case looks awesome, and has plenty of space for added fans ...
customer_reviews.text: Case looks awesome, and has plenty of space for added fans and cable management. the only complaint that i have is that for a first time builder the instructions were really lacking, the assembly was straight forward and so was the installation of the parts, however there was little to no direction for the cables that came in the case for the power and fan speed controller. the positive is that it comes with around 8 plugs spliced to the fan controller to plug additional case fans in, so you don't need to use all the fan slots on your Mobo, just plug them into the fan controller.
customer_reviews.author: michael brockett

customer_reviews.title: Very well set up
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality case for the money. I upgraded from an Antec case that had lost two fans due to mechanical failure. It only took me about an hour to get everything swapped over to this new case and hooked up. They have done the wiring very well so that the case wires don't get in the way of things. Plenty of space to work with inside the case, which is great. They also include all the screws and mechanical hardware that you need.
customer_reviews.author: Thorin Thunderfoot

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case
customer_reviews.text: The NZXT Phantom 410 is a smaller version of it's counterpart, the NZXT Phantom. PROS: - Perfect for any gaming PC - Large enough for good cooling system - Large enough for multiple upgrades (including video cards, HDDs, SSDs, and more fans) - Awesome blue LEDs on the fans you can set at different brightnesses CONS: - Minor cable confusion for a beginner (though this case is made for extremely good cable management so once you figure it out, you're good) - Kinda heavy so be careful moving it Overall, 6/5
customer_reviews.author: Walle R.

customer_reviews.title: very clean and unique looking case. good wire management
customer_reviews.text: Great case good airflow. Bought this case a year and a half ago and I wouldn't have done it any differently! Although in my opinion when the computer is under a lot of stress the stock fans got a little load. Not very loud at all. I'd compare it to maybe an xbox one? But, I had to replace them with aftermarket fans which were 30$ a piece! The aftermarket fans are very quiet and got the job done. Definitely recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: lucas dearaujo

customer_reviews.title: Case should be a full tower Jr.
customer_reviews.text: Has lots of space. plenty of fan options. Looks sexy. Fan controller works great. Colors match from metal to plastic. Cable management is a breeze. Tool less drive bays work as intended. But... Led fans in the front cause light to bleed through any adjacent plastic panels. Had to spray paint inside of plastic panels to remove bleed. Looks way better now. Required space for push pull on top is impossible with my Biostar 990Fx mobo. Maybe some others allow the clearance but mine does not. I am a corsair fanboy. I'll admit it. ...but, this NZXT case, I loved since I first saw it. Was down to the wire from deciding between Vengeance C70 case and Phantom 410.
customer_reviews.author: CMHill

customer_reviews.title: Overall good Mid Tower
customer_reviews.text: Overall the NZXT Phantom 410 mid tower case is pretty good. Has everything you would need for an up to date tower to include USB 3.0 and plenty of room for HDD/SSD's. Even can add additional fans to internal mounted HDD bay that can be removed. Few problems I had with the case: Tool less HDD pins stripped HDD holes and had to hard mount with screws Pre-cable management with multiple fan cables had to be cut and moved to better organize layout once fully put together. Use's extenders for fans which don't fit every MB. Cheap rubber for cable mangement holes that if you are not careful will come off when putting cables through.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: I love the way this case looked when I ordered it
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this case looked when I ordered it, and was please with how it looked when it arrived. Beautiful sexy looking case with 3 huge fans. I have to be honest tho, when I say huge fans put out about as much noise as they do air to cool what's inside. The front bay door that covers the optical drives, is sleek looking, but although not difficult to open, is a bit of a pain to both open and close at times. I could see improvements being made in future models, but over all I'm pleased with this one
customer_reviews.author: SlyJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case....
customer_reviews.text: Crazy amount of space, I would say on the larger size for a mid-tower. I really love the cable management, everything is pretty much hidden so airflow is great. I did have to cut a small amount of metal off the top to fit a coolermaster seidon 240m water cooler because of the port. I don't think it will be an issue for other brands. The fans have white leds. This is a great sub $100 case. I have a zotac gtx 780 amp and I removed the middle hard drive rack. I think it would fit without it, but I wanted the extra airflow and I was not using them anyway.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: pc case
customer_reviews.text: do not buy this item . when you get every thing in right the pc case fans that's comes with it and the case and the conter fan will somke up . iam glade I was watching it when I turn it on .
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: I love this case
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this case it was found to be defective and the fans not working, I returned it and got a replacement 4 days later (2 days early from when it said it was gonna arrive) and the case fans worked. I love this case, it has a easy-to-open hard drive slot, easy to put in motherboard, cable management is awesome and the case looks cool with LEDS. I had problems at the beginning but with all the features inside, it completely makes up for it!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Carlson

customer_reviews.title: This isn't your typical mid-tower case.
customer_reviews.text: If you think this is the usual mid-tower computer case, you are gonna be dead wrong about this one. Excellent craftsmanship and very well thoughtout for design. I got this while it was on sale for $60 recently, what a steal! What else can I say, that the interior is huge inside with many options of customization or that cable management is a snap?! This is a perfect case for anyone who needs the space and capacity for the computer you have in mind to build or upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best cases. The only one which I liked more ...
customer_reviews.text: I assemble lot of PCs. I have tried with almost all of the cases including Fractal Design, Silverstone, Corsair from Mid Tower to Full Tower sizes. This is one of the best cases. The only one which I liked more than this was Cooler Master Storm Trooper - Full Tower. But that is bit costly as well. Otherwise no complains from this case. Study with good lights and big fans are a big plus for this case.
customer_reviews.author: Atul Ojha

customer_reviews.title: Great, good looking case
customer_reviews.text: Love this case. Fits everything you would want and more for a typical of build. Might not have enough space for water cooling, but I haven't tried. Looks awesome I just wish there was an option to turn the fan lights completely off. Would definitely recommend buying more fans for it as it only comes with two if I recall correctly. I've actually replaced the ones that come with it with slightly more efficient models with no lights because I didn't really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Jaden M.

customer_reviews.title: A great looking, and well made case.
customer_reviews.text: When I got the idea to build a new gaming/work PC, I knew I wanted a Phantom case. I've seen them around the internet and thought they just looked so awesome. After I ordered I got it 2 days later. The packaging was very well done and it protected the case pretty well. The case feels very strong and sturdy, and I was very suprised by its size. It's much bigger than I expected. The case has very good ventilation and is very aesthetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor D

customer_reviews.title: Great case, just wish it came with extra fan mounting screws.
customer_reviews.text: The case has no negatives that I have found yet, it is a solid metal and the plastic feels tough enough to get you by. The amount of fan controller plugs is enough to fit as many fans as the case can hold, and the included 140mm fan has LEDs. It comes with the needed screws, standoffs, etc. Only negative is it only comes with front fan mounting screws, so if you want to move the front fan you need to either purchase more or figure something else out. My assumption is the 140mm fans I bought will include screws so I have no issue with this really.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Beck

customer_reviews.title: Its a pretty neat case
customer_reviews.text: The case is great and has a lot of space for everything. I put an h100gtx and it fit perfectly, 2 HDD and an SSD, full sixed EVGA gtx 970ftw, a full ATX mother board, and it looks beautiful. Only thing i kind of dont like is the blue LED fan pre-installed and the gloss finish around the case. I got a NZXT hue+ and I'm going to either have to remove the fan or replace it because of how bright it is and the case just gathers up fingerprints everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: GTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Overall this is a nice entry level case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for my first build in a while. There are a few things that make me rate the build quality lower than I would have: - the front cover plate - the hdd trey - the front panel connectors (actually they are on the top panel) All the parts mentioned above are made of cheaper plastic, which I could see becoming an issue over time. Other than issues mentioned above, there's no removable dust filter for any fan mounts, and it might just make cleaning that much harder. Overall this is a nice entry level case, but there are better ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: I had this for a year now and it's freaking awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I kinda regret spending so much money for a case where the money could have been used better elsewhere but this should last me years. It was well thought out and has tons of room to add stuff later but I cant imagine ever needing all the space it provides. The good thing about buying such a big case is that it's so much easier building your system. I'd buy it again but I just wish the price was less.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: but other than that it's not all the great. The hdd bays are poor quality and the ...
customer_reviews.text: The case is large enough to house everything as needed, but other than that it's not all the great. The hdd bays are poor quality and the outside of the case isn't any better. The top panel doesn't go back together properly once it's taken off and the door to access the disc drive is terribly designed. You have to press harder than any other case I've ever seen, and it won't lock unless you press in one spot that's no bigger than my finger tip. The plexiglass panel on the side is nice, but both sides are surprisingly hard to line up for some reason. Rather disappointed with this case, likely won't buy another NZXT case for a while
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sweet pc case!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one great case, not five stars because the window is kind of not sturdy, the tool less hard drive mounts are hard to work with and the mesh covers that are inside the case that cover the cable management keep falling out when putting cables through. Other than than its rock solid, it's cool looking case, the fans are sweet and hardly any noise. The lights are nice effects. The front cover for the 5 1/2 drive gets stuck on occasion but how often do we use those now with the digital market. Keeps my system cool and ppl love it when they come to my home.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Allen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this case! be aware that this tower is considered a mid size, but it's enormous, I'm not complaining I actually love that, it even has a panel on the side of the case to manage all your cables! wonderful case. On a side note, I managed to change the lights from blue to red by detaching the little board on the top of the case, I used 3mm LED's and it looks diabolic!! if you need more info on how to do it let me know, I'll give you a hand.. (you're gonna need to do some minor soldering)
customer_reviews.author: Warchief

customer_reviews.title: Great case, looks amazing
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this case, it looks awesome, and it has great features for its price point. PROS: Space (lots of room and cable management) Black interior (Great finish, no sharp edges) Good airflow CONS: Hard Drive cages are a serious pain, it took me some time to put my drives in when building my rig The ON Button, it gets stuck sometimes, making the PC reboot until you get it to pop back out Overall a great case, some minor details to have in mind
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mid-tower. Great cable management
customer_reviews.text: Amazing mid-tower. Great cable management, sturdy tower. I have fans in all applicable points (2 120mm fans on the front. 2 140mm fans on top, 1 140mm fan in the rear, 1 120mm fan by the hard drives, & 1 fan on the side of the case). With all these fans, I purchased the nzxt touchscreen fan management system. I am in love!!!
customer_reviews.author: GgAcE

customer_reviews.title: The fan and wiring layout works well so it isn't too terrible a hassle to switch parts out
customer_reviews.text: This case has room for my full size 1080 graphics card. The fan and wiring layout works well so it isn't too terrible a hassle to switch parts out.. There's space for a liquid cooling solution. The storm trooper case design stands out.
customer_reviews.author: Nutstomp

customer_reviews.title: just weird things like that. Otherwise its a great case
customer_reviews.text: I took off one star because the header with the USB and audio ports and fan controls on the top of the case seems wonky. Everytime I boot up my computer I have to move my usb wireless adapter between usb ports for my computer to recognize it. If I unplug my audio cable to internet disconnects... just weird things like that. Otherwise its a great case, has enough room to install a corsair h100i v2 water cooler with the radiator in the top compartment and the fans attached through the main.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best case i've owned
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this case, the paint on the frame has no imperfections and the plastic on the front and top has a very solid feel. I have all the fan slots filled currently with NZXT fans and the case gets great airflow. Working in the case is very easy and after taking out the extra hard drive bays, was able to fit in a large 780. My only complaint it that is was hard to fit my Kraken x40 cooler in the top of the case but that was mostly due to the large heat shield on my motherboard. Overall a very solid and beautiful looking case.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Well designed. Plenty of room.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first computer build. I was impressed with how planned-out this case is. I do wish these companies would put more USB 2.0 and 3.0 outlets on them, but this one is as good as any other. Looks very nice. Doesn't have that klunky "Made by the BORG" look to it. Plenty of room for a Cooler Master 212hyper cpu cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Love this case
customer_reviews.text: Durable, easy to store a bunch of cords, and good fans! I have to hit it sometimes to make the fans go a bit more silent, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Kappa

customer_reviews.title: the side cases do not come off very easily, and the headphone jack has become slightly unreliable ...
customer_reviews.text: As you can tell from the pictures, this is a gorgeous case. It is also well ventilated and spacious for a single GPU setup. However, I have had a few very minor issues. The front sometimes makes a vibrating noise (very annoying), the side cases do not come off very easily, and the headphone jack has become slightly unreliable after 9 months. You can find a slightly better case for the money, but it won't look this good!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case.
customer_reviews.text: This case works amazing for my first build. The wise holes are so convenient. My only minor complaint is that when the computer goes to sleep the LED on the front flashes. There's a blue LED on the top, but not the front. You can adjust the brightness, but it's barely noticeable. The optical drive door can be a bit of a pain to close. Those are the only complaints I can think of, but they don't take away from the beauty or ease of use that comes with this case.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: This is a great case. The cable ports are nice with a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case. The cable ports are nice with a few good places to hook zip ties to. It has a nice drive bay near the front of the case. The top vent is good for the radiator I have for my water cooler (2 x 140 mm). Screws for the panels are easy to remove. The clips for the other panels are super easy to get off. Quite happy with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: I love this case and would gladly use it in future ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this case and would gladly use it in future builds. The case has good air flow and has plenty of room for cable management. I only have 2 complaints keepong me from giving this a 5 star review. The cons are that the rubber on the slots to help with cable management on the sides of the case easily fall off, as i constantly spent my time needing to reput them on. Another con on this product is the front usb port with the fan speed controller and headphone jack feels very flimsy when plugging something into a port. Overall its a great case with many pros that outway the cons.
customer_reviews.author: Smitt Kutil

customer_reviews.title: So Efficient! Stunning Presence!
customer_reviews.text: Mind-blowingly good! Mine is packed with a 4770K@4.4 and two reference AMD Radeon R9 290s... all cooled on air! It is unbelievably quiet (even with the R9 290s) and cool. My motherboard (at load) is around 45C. The processor reaches 79C with a Noctua U14S. The 290s, no matter what, reach 95C. However, they hold their factory clocked speed more often at a lower fan speed than I ran before. Very impressive to say the least!
customer_reviews.author: Antman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CONCEPT ... lacks finishing product
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically it looked awesome when I took it out of the huge package it came in. I was soon checking it out, opening it and unscrewing bolts then i suddenly noticed that the plastic part to see into the PC was broken. The hinges on the plastic that clamped onto the metal hooks were broken. It wouldn't bother me if it stayed flush to the computer but now there is a noticeable bend to it which to someone who likes things perfect, or done right, is annoying. Honestly, I definitely would buy this again, it looks awesome but they need to take more care of their products!
customer_reviews.author: ShopGirl707

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tower. Sharp aesthetic, superb design.. I would highly recommend it. If using the side and bottom as intakes, they don't have dust filters, but you can easily purchase them. However, the front and top (if using as intake) have a mesh grille, but I found it rather ineffective at stopping micro dust since the holes are pretty large. My DIY solution involved cutting out a fine mesh screen to the desired shape, then gluing/taping them onto the mesh grille. Works perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle and move
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room! My hands are a bit on the larger side, making it hard for me to install parts without scraping. This case is lovely and large without excess weight. Easy to handle and move, if need be. Made install with my hardware easy.
customer_reviews.author: Sea breeze

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful case just a few little things.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome case, plenty of drive bays, looks clean, decent window, and for the look a pretty good price. Have only two complaints and one of them is just a warning, The drive bay pins that hold the drives in pop out a lot and were tore up pretty bad after finally getting the drives in. And this case is an EXTREME dust magnet, so take caution.
customer_reviews.author: kisky

customer_reviews.title: Aside from the "tool-less" HD trays (which I'm just in general not a fan of) its a great case. Flexible with custom airflow's an
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it was able to fit the H100i cooler without any case modding. Aside from the "tool-less" HD trays (which I'm just in general not a fan of) its a great case. Flexible with custom airflow's and lots of room to tuck away wires without obstructing anything. Love the gunmetal shade and is really smooth. Fit my needs and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean A.

customer_reviews.title: great case!
customer_reviews.text: This case has lots of internal space for a fully-equipped PC without being jumbo-sized. I found it very easy to install my components, and was able to route my cables behind the MB and provide a very clean and orderly layout. I like the look too - got tired of black - and even appreciate the window enough to use LED fans for the exhaust. I'd buy another of these cases in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Pete Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Game Build
customer_reviews.text: Did a game build in this case, it was easy to work with. It is the biggest case we have used. It is well built, has more than enough space for any amount of drives you may want to install. It has ways to hide the wire runs to maintain a clean install. It was a fun build and I wil use this case in future builds.
customer_reviews.author: Alex V.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chassis
customer_reviews.text: This case has great airflow possibilities and a good amount of space. All panels snap on/off, making configuration and cable management easy. Fan controller works great (for me at least). People complain about the plastic panels, but it's not as bad as they make it out to be. The full-size Phantom might have more room, but it you're on a budget and looking for a cool mid-size chassis, you could do a lot worse than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: spacious quiet fans
customer_reviews.text: So much room inside! Love the 3 exhaust fans that come with the case, they are very quiet or can be switch with the button on top of the case to a 3rd position to increase RPM's. Excellent gaming case for my Asus M5A97 R2.0 with Hydro 60 (newest editions) liquid cooler. Did have to move one larger fan to another adjacent location to install the radiator, it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Really great tower, well designed
customer_reviews.text: Really great tower, well designed, metal sides not flimsy, just could not figure out all the 3 prong fan power cables, must be 7 of them so I just bypassed them & plugged the fans directly into the motherboard for BIOS temperature monitoring fan control. Would be nice if they had a couple of SSD 2.5 in. sports.
customer_reviews.author: Black Rat

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my build
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my build. Great quality, smart setup of the drive bays including one that is removable if you don't need it or need more graphics card room. I didn't use the built in fan controller, but may buy some ancillary fans and hook them to it (instead of the motherboard headers). This is a great looking case.....I expect a transformer to appear in it's place one day soon.
customer_reviews.author: D. Herndon

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case. Pros: Design, Space, Packaging, USB3.0 on top, Lighting Cons: When in sleep mode, the lights inside blink very brightly, and I have to drape something over this case in order to put ME into sleep mode. UPDATE SIX YEARS LATER: I still love this case. A fan broke after 5 years of continuous use. I used this case to build my first computer, and have only purchased NZXT cases for my personal computers ever since.
customer_reviews.author: V. Pale

customer_reviews.title: Great Case!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case. Plenty of room to put almost anything you need in and it just looks awesome. Has plenty of room for airflow and additional fans too. The fans are cheap, so get extras and put them all over. I have 6 extra fans, keeps my system running very cool. I run ultra graphics at 200% resolution, so it takes a lot of power, but the airflow allows the system to stay cool. Totally recommend this case. Its the whole package
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Case plenty of room
customer_reviews.text: I owned this case for 2 years, eventually selling it during a new build process. For that time, it was quiet, reliable and well constructed. There is plenty of room for cable management and AIOs. Plenty of room for hard drives, making it a great server case as well.
customer_reviews.author: Branches

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Case
customer_reviews.text: This case is roomy, very quiet, and sexy. It is not boring. I have both this version and the one in white. The design makes putting together the computer enjoyable - no more cuts and trying to figure out where to tie cables. The lower power supply location and behind the mother board cable tie area helps eliminate cable messes. Note: You must press in a specific spot on the center edge of the door to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Lovelops

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 out of 5
customer_reviews.text: Long story short: I ordered two. A friend of mine and myself wanted to build a PC because it's been awhile since have done so. We both agreed on almost everything about what I'm typing. So here's is the one and only reason we gave it a 4.5 instead of a full 5. We expected the cases to be slightly smaller and abit lighter for being a "mid-tower." However, again, we have been out of the PC building life and underestimated this aspect. Everything else is awesome. You have plenty of room to work around. Tons of space for HD's. Cable management is sexah. Etc... Which is the main reasons we purchased this beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Nameless

customer_reviews.title: Best Case on the Planet
customer_reviews.text: I'm speechless. That's all that I can say, just read other people's reviews and you'll understand. Why wouldn't you want this?
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case
customer_reviews.text: Looks awesome once it's set up and with lights in it the gun-metal looks mean. Has enough space for everything needed and reminds me of alienware back in the day before they were bought by Dell and started producing garbage. Check out the pictures for the build I used this in.
customer_reviews.author: LankyFrenchman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case
customer_reviews.text: Best case I've owned in a while. Its got plenty of room, lots of fan spaces, you can fir a dual radiator on top of the case, it has a simple fan control that allows to change fro quiet to performance. its got plenty of fan connections directly from the USB fan control, and its has an amazing design. I strongly recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: Erick T.

customer_reviews.title: This case is a beautiful case that does everything as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This case is a beautiful case that does everything as advertised. I used this case in my most recent build and everything i tried to install in this case was an ease. This was my first custom built pc and this case is well organized and really helps you mount your motherboard with step by step instructions. This case has many USB 3.0 ports and is just one of the best looking mid sized cases out there.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey123

customer_reviews.title: Pretty to look at, frustrating to build with.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber grommets inside the case fall off with the slightest movement and are hard as heck to get back in place. Also the side panels came partially bowed towards the top, which makes them hard to secure in place. And be careful when carrying the case from the front, because the front panel will pop off without warning. By far, the most frustrating case I've had to deal with, but it's pretty when it's done. Would I buy another Phantom 410 in the future for my next build? I think I'll probably stick with Cooler Master products, but that's no promise.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic case
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this case. Only issue I have is that I have 4 of the fans hooked up to the case's fan controller. Every time I turn on the PC I need to manually turn on the fans (even if I leave them on "ON" when I turn off the case.). Might just by how I wired the fans, but wish they would automatically kick on when I just power up the system (much like the fans connected to the MoBo).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Its very easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Its very easy to work with, but some of the metal screw on areas seem to be made of real soft metal making it far too easy to strip. Just need to be very careful. Other then that its a nice case to use for a build and to add more fans too to it so its customized to your tastes.
customer_reviews.author: hooksett tech dude

customer_reviews.title: Great Price with only a few complaints
customer_reviews.text: very nice case easy install for the board and there was clearance for the hyper 212evo cooler the lighted top exhaust fan was a nice touch with a simple white it had the feel of an aquarium. everything about this case is solid an I would recommend for the price The case was to small to fit my 6990HD graphics card with the HD bay. so with only two slots at the bottom I am missing a few drives. The case fan plugs were a bad fit to the mobo The rubber grommets came out a so many times during wiring I removed them the quick slide out trays for the hard drives are just bad.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: cheap, yet amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great case, amazing air flow through the whole case. Good cable management. Awesome design, noise is ok, but I use a gaming headset at all times so I never hear it. Amazing service, I was on accident sent the wrong case, I emailed them and withing 24 hrs I was sending the case back and recited the correct one the next day, I do wish u could remove more of the hard drive slots, I only have one but I have to keep the other slots attached, restricting air flow but I think it's fine. This is a must buy at a great price
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case and has a lot of customization features
customer_reviews.text: Excellent case and has a lot of customization features. One of my 140mm fan was broken and contacted NZXT who shipper a replacement for free. I love the design and the fan speed controller as well.
customer_reviews.author: Salemm

customer_reviews.title: This is the third PC I've built using these cases. Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I only build about 12 PC's a year and I used to use whichever case I was asked to use, or if it was for me, a Cooler Master. I was asked to use a NZXT case for a friends build last year and I was hooked. I replaced my excellent case with this one and built 2 more for myself using NZXT cases. They keep it cool inside without being noisy PLUS they have a great spot in the top to hide a radiator for liquid cooling. something Im going to try on my next personal PC, soon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schlegel

customer_reviews.title: Great sub-$100 case
customer_reviews.text: I love the overall look of this case. The cable management was average. Didn't really have anywhere extra to stuff cables but the grommets and metal hoops are well placed. It was kind of tight to work in but I didn't have any real problems.
customer_reviews.author: Helifano

customer_reviews.title: I love this case
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. I was looking for a white computer case and I liked the Phantom 410s shape so I bought it. The case has a ton of space for cable management and drives, and it has 2 solid LED fans (with room for more). I would warn you that this case is VERY big and proportionally heavy. I recommend this case if you plan to keep it in mostly one place or if you expect to need a lot of room for cables, drives, graphics cards, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: meh...
customer_reviews.text: The design is great but the cover clips are made of cheep plastic pinch clips that break off very easily. Once they break off, the cover (top and front) are not secured. HANDLE WITH EXTREME CARE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Neal Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This case is absolutely one of the best PC cases I have come across in the past few years. It is a very high quality product that meets every need and want. Expandability and future proof is a huge plus for me. Wire management and layout is perfect, you cannot go wrong with this case! I think that this product is a full tower not a mid-tower as it can house all the gaming needs you could possibly want.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Honestly this thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: A little bigger than I anticipated, I think that the formed front and top make it feel larger than other cases similar in internal volume. The pass through make cable management easy, Everything mounted up and fit perfectly. I was thinking of getting other fans, but the ones that came with it seem to keep everything really cool. Only one of the fans is LED lit. I thought from the description that they all were, but it is just the top one. Still looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Danimal

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome! Love the gunmetal grey
customer_reviews.text: Looks awesome! Love the gunmetal grey. Plenty of space for expansion. Would not consider it a mid tower though. Wires are really easy to distinguish, plenty of space to hide the mess of wires. The white LEDs look awesome with all my red MSI innards. Make sure the side face is really snug so you do not get a rattle. Overall an awesome case!
customer_reviews.author: Llamachamaboat

customer_reviews.title: Decent Case for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great Case, well designed. I wish the buttons on the top were better quality(my power buttons flacky). They could have done a better job with the disk drive cover. Feels very cheap. If the power button was not cheap and flacky i would have given it 4.5 stars instead I gave it a 4.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: My son is building his own computer and he decided on this. It is very durable and heavier than most. It is made of high quality and we were very impressed. Packaging was great as well. Highly recommend! It fit everything that he needed it for perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Plenty of room. Looks great. Very workable. Black looks great. Cons: I feel the front door opens the wrong way. The way i have it on my desk, i have the window facing me but i have to reach around the case to open the door. not worth dropping a star. The case looks great, feels well made, and is roomy. There are a lot of fan options which is always good. Plenty of HDD/SSD bays. So many options overall.
customer_reviews.author: Carrissa

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: Love this case! It's very well designed and easy to install components in; I really like the location of access holes for wires, the removable drive bays, and easy-to-remove side panels. Plus, it looks sweet! Very pleased with this purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Micah Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Come in different colors.. not white
customer_reviews.text: Well.. this was disappointing.. I’m in the air force and I’m stationed overseas. Returning things from amazon is basically impossible so I’m sorta stuck with this case. The box says white but my case came in grey. Now I’m stuck with this and minus 250 bucks from my pocket. Yay...
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Kim

customer_reviews.title: its been too long to try to return it cause it was working fine at first
customer_reviews.text: I think i got the wrong one tbh, and now it's causing problems with my hardware. but whatever, its been too long to try to return it cause it was working fine at first. just make sure they send what you are actually wanting and that everything will fit in it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Box!  Power button gets a little gummed up though.
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 stars here because the power button gets gummed up. It is facing upward so dust can just fall in there. I use the edges of an empty blister back from Nyquil and rub it around the edges to loosen things up. Then blast it with an air can. Also, some of the extra fan power lines aren't working right. This is such a pretty box. Gun Metal is pretty much my favorite color.
customer_reviews.author: M. Olayan

customer_reviews.title: 4/5 pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I liked the case, it looks nice, it has all the features a gaming case should require, and I haven't run into too many problems with it. I subtracted a star because of 2 things a. The rubber grommets for cable management are held by nothing and was a bit frustrating. b. The case came with a dent in it. Luckily I could reset the dent, leaving just a minor, unnoticeable by sight, scratch on the front, but I shouldn't have to do that. In all, very pleased despite the minor setbacks and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Szigeti

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case!
customer_reviews.text: I did a mild build and this case has enough room for more. Very good looks and is very sturdy. I wish the window was bigger on these models, but still looks great. Has plenty room for fans, big heat-sink, big PCU, anything. The only thing this case should have come with is a memory card reader. That is sold separate, bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfo C.

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case based on reviews from Amazon and other websites. I absolutely love this case! Came well packaged with all parts (and then some). Has 3 installed fans which are very good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: My hardware didn't fit properly in this case, and the front panel felt incredibly flimsy. I returned it and wouldn't recommend this for anybody that wants a durable case.
customer_reviews.author: crazymama

customer_reviews.title: Was pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: I built in this case not too long ago, and it was pretty easy. Only reason I didn't give this 5 starts was because the case was delivered either not put correctly or changed while being shipped. There was also a piece flying around in the case which happened to be the bottom part of the removable hard drive case tab. This case is very beautiful though and I would recommend this to any friend. It will fit any gtx 960 with the removable hard drive case.
customer_reviews.author: Olmedo

customer_reviews.title: Bold and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: From the second I got this case. I went crazy all over it. It's a really beautiful case and when you first get it and look at it. Your like "this thing is big" But. Despite being that way. You'll love it. I got me a white one and it's beautiful all over, inside and out, and if you're going to do water cooling this is the case for you. Everything fits perfectly and there's more than enough room for everything, even with a ATX motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Alfredo Orellana Ponce

customer_reviews.title: awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Very Large lots of Room, i would consider this Full Tower, but with todays graphics cards getting into the SLI system, maybe this could be a midtower. Either way, very nice design, great price and fast shipping. THanks.
customer_reviews.author: PolishPanda

customer_reviews.title: Very beautiful case!
customer_reviews.text: This is a mid-tower case but is a little bigger than normal mid-tower cases due to the added vent area on the top where you can fit two 120mm or 140mm case fans for cooling. The only con to this case is that it attracts pet hair very easily. If you have a pet that sheds often and has dark hair, the hair will be easily visible on the case. Great case for the price though, has so many expansion slots for optical drives, ssd's, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: ( this is about my 7 build) cable management was the best I have worked with
customer_reviews.text: The nicest case, I have had the pleasure of building in.( this is about my 7 build) cable management was the best I have worked with. The case fans are quite. One thing I found helpful. remove the mid drive cage and then move the front fan up one space. helped cool the GPU with less fan speed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my brother's build and he loves it! The design is great, the case itself is sturdy, and it's nice and roomy inside. It fit all of his components and cable management was rather easy. The only problem was the 5.25" bay locking mechanism, though partially it was because we were not familiar with using this type of lock so we kept messing that up. Added a couple extra fans for intake and exhaust and everything was golden!
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: The clips holding the removable 3.5 mm hard drive bays arrived damaged, meaning if I ever have to move the case I will have to first open and remove this section from the case, so it wont slide out and damage any of my internal components. All attempts to get (just this part) replaced yielded no fruit. Even after a series of emails inclusive of pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Glendon

customer_reviews.title: Great form and function
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case, had no major problems building my computer with it. Everyone who sees it comments on how great it looks. The only complaint is that the drive bays are a little shallow it seems, I had to almost force my standard 3.5 HDD in there with the side shut, but the SSD I bought fits just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Goom

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and roomy. I love the gunmetal color. Cable management is much easier with the deeply recessed motherboard tray. I took the middle drive bays out just to improve airflow even more, but I could've left them in and my XFX R9 390 still would've fit.
customer_reviews.author: Flynne

customer_reviews.title: Very good case
customer_reviews.text: This case has excellent cable management and plenty of room for a mid tower. It is physically bigger than most mid tower cases. I added an optional 140mm top exhaust fan and a second 120mm intake fan. At highest setting, it's still tolerable and at lowest fan setting, it's very quiet. It keeps everything in my system cool. Some system info: AMD 8350 @ 4.3ghz with NZXT Havik 140 (30 degrees idle, 40 degrees gaming) Asus 7850 (28 degrees idle)
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Beltran

customer_reviews.title: NZXT Phantom 410 Mid Tower
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful case, only con is I wish it was all steel instead of plastic. Warning plastic is a dust magnet. If you keep it clean this like an alienware system. i've gotten quite a few compliments on how stealthy it looks. I was able to fit a Corsair H100i at the top with no problem. Didn't not have any problems fitting in the components. I also love the fact that it has 4 USB ports at the top 2 USB 2.0 and 2 USB 3.0. Good case for a good price. Gives you room for expansion.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Tejeda

customer_reviews.title: It was cool to see my rig and led fans
customer_reviews.text: It was cool to see my rig and led fans, but those same fans became an annoyance at night so i had to swap them out with regular fans. The led for power and hard drive activity on the front of the case worked only for a day and i never saw those lights ever since. but the case is super easy to take apart to clean and is kinda reminds me of the alienware desktop towers.
customer_reviews.author: Alick Z

customer_reviews.title: Great case.
customer_reviews.text: This unique-looking case makes building and adding drives to the PC extremely easy. The removable face makes it easy to see the SATA connectors on the edge of my motherboard, which are under my video card, when adding cables. The paint has a nice feel to it, like car paint.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M. Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Nice case. This case is very easy to work ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice case. This case is very easy to work with. I do suggesting dusting out the inside once ever 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: LR

product_meta.title: NZXT Phantom 410 Mid Tower Computer Case , Red (CA-PH410-R1)
product_meta.description: Color:RedNZXT introduces the next descendant of the revolutionary Phantom, the Phantom 410. The beautiful and sleek Phantom design set the trend of all white chassis and idealized optimal expansion and cooling. In comparison to its predecessor, the Phantom 410 delivers more value for every dollar spent and possesses an acrylic window that allows gamers to admire the power of their rig. The Phantom 410 features an innovative right mounted HDD rails, a solution for easy hard drive replacement. This mid tower comes equipped with a dual radiator water cooling solution with a clearance of 30mm, an interior pivot 120mm/140mm fan slot, the capability of installing up to 8 fans, and a single 30W fan control. The Phantom comes with up-to-date internal 2x USB 3.0 headers that directly connect to the motherboard. Be the envy of all PC gamers - the Phantom 410 is bringing sexy back.
feature_bullets: Clearance for top 240 millimeter dual radiator for water cooling solutions/adjustable interior pivot 120/140 millimeter fan slot for directional air flow
Removable HDD cage to allow more room for extended video cards/innovative right mounted hdd rails for easy hard drive replacement
Single 120 millimeter /140 millimeter side fan with acrylic window for interior viewing and cooling/front internal 2x USB 3.0 headers, 2x USB 2.0, audio and microphone input
30w 3step fan control for setting up your system for silence or performance/wire management support up to 25 millimeter space for easy cable management
Screwless 5.25" and HDD trays that secures 2.5" ssd/cooling capability of upto eight fans (2x 120 millimeter and 1x 140 millimeter led fan included)

Case type mid tower steel/front panel material plastic/dimensions (w x h x d) 215 x 516 x 532 millimeter/vga clearance maximum 305 millimeter (w/o fan), 280 millimeter (installed), 230 millimeter (full pivot)
Drive bays 3 external 5.25" drive bays/6 internal 3.5" slots/screwless rail design/material(s) steel/expansion slots 7/weight 9 kg/motherboard support ATX, MicroATX, Miniitx
Drive bays 3 external 5.25" drive bays/6 internal 3.5" slots/screwless rail design/material(s) steel/expansion slots 7/weight 9 kg/motherboard support ATX, MicroATX, Miniitx

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,209 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
